title: Society and Technology: The Space Observing Imperative
summary: Scientific spacecraft programs are too important to the United States' welfare and our leadership in the world to ever shortchange or undervalue them through poor policy decisions

title: BlackSky seeks to extend operations of satellites running on empty
summary: BlackSky is requesting permission to operate two of its satellites in lower orbits as the spacecraft are running out of propellant.

title: Rocket Report: China selling reusable engines; can SpaceX still raise money?
summary: "We all know that China and Russia and others have been doing lots of flights."

title: Orbex Breaks Ground On UK Mainland's First Vertical Launch Facility
summary: Orbex, a UK-based rocket service provider for small satellites, has begun the construction of the first vertical launch spaceport on the UK mainland, located on the North coast of Scotland.

title: Boeing preparing to ship milestone O3b mPower satellites for launch
summary: The last pair of satellites SES needs to provide upgraded broadband services from medium Earth orbit have completed tests ahead of an early June launch, SES said during financial results May 4.
